person.persName: John Stuart Williams (Clark County, Kentucky, brigadier general (CSA))

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, soldier and attorney. Mount Sterling, Kentucky native. Married to Ann P. Harrison in Clark County, Kentucky on May 19, 1842. Father of Molly Williams. Passed the bar and established law practice in Paris, Kentucky in 1840. Served as colonel of the 4th Kentucky Volunteers in the Mexican-American War. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky in 1850. Elected to Kentucky legislature in 1851 and 1853. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) as colonel from November 16, 1861 to April 16, 1862. Promoted to brigadier general on April 16, 1862 and commanded the Department of Southwestern Virginia. Participated in Atlanta Campaign in 1864.
